summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: The Hundred-Foot Journey Review Date: 2017/04/08 Store: Helen Mirren (Actor), Om Puri (Actor), Lasse Hallstrom (Director), Lasse Hallström (Director) & 1 more Rated: PG-13 Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Award Winners in Movies & TV, Golden Globe Central, Golden Globe Nominees Product Description: ["Starring Academy Award(R) winner Helen Mirren (Best Actress, THE QUEEN, 2006), produced by Steven Speilberg, Oprah Winfrey and Juliet Blake, and directed by Lasse HallstrÃ¶m (CHOCOLAT), this uplifting story bursts with flavor, passion and heart. When the chilly chef proprietress of a Michelin-starred French restaurant in southern France (Mirren) gets wind of a culinary immigrant opening an Indian restaurant just 100 feet from her own, her icy protests escalate to all-out war between the two establishments. It's a celebration of triumph over exile as these two worlds collide and one young man tries to find the comfort of home in every pot -- wherever he may be."] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Romantic Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Lasse Hallstrom, Michel Blanc, Farzana Dua Elahe, Manish Dayal, Clement Sibony, Steven Spielberg, Charlotte Le Bon, Om Puri, Rohan Chand, Amit Shah, Juliet Blake, Lasse Hallström, Helen Mirren, Dillon Mitra, Oprah Winfrey, Clément Sibony, Juhi ChawlaLasse Hallstrom, Michel Blanc, Farzana Dua Elahe, Manish Dayal, Clement Sibony, Steven Spielberg, Charlotte Le Bon, Om Puri, Rohan Chand, Amit Shah, Juliet Blake, Lasse Hallström, Helen Mirren, Dillon Mitra, Oprah Winfrey, Clément Sibony, Juhi Chawla See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 2 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.39:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'DRWR12365700DVD', 'Director': 'Lasse Hallstrom, Lasse Hallström', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 2 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 20, 2015', 'Actors': 'Helen Mirren, Om Puri, Manish Dayal, Charlotte Le Bon, Amit Shah', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, French', 'Producers': 'Juliet Blake, Oprah Winfrey, Steven Spielberg', 'Studio': 'Walt Disney Studios Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: One of my favorite movies; full of color, culture, French and Indian cuisine. Just a great movie! I read the book recently (after having already loved the movie), and I will admit that the movie departs from the book on a very many levels. But in my opinion, the changes only added to the great story. Review Title: Love this movie! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/04/24 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jay Chapman'], 'Producers': ['Rhett McLaughlin', 'Link Neal', 'Brian Flanagan', 'Stevie Wynne Levine', 'Jacob Moncrief'], 'Starring': ['Rhett McLaughlin', 'Link Neal'], 'Studio': ['Mythical Entertainment']} Review Text: My sister and I went to the Tour of Mythicality's final stop in Raleigh-Durham and I have never laughed so much in my life (actually I laughed so hard that I strained a rib muscle that I felt for months after the concert whenever I'd laugh too hard...worth it)
I'm a huge fan of Rhett and Link and watch their youtube show daily. That night was an experience I got to share with my sister and will never forget. This was a great throwback to a great night and also includes some behind the scenes which was fun to watch.

Recommend it for the mythical beasts out there Review Title: Great way to remember the Tour of Mythicality Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/03/09 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Tom Vaughan', 'Sandra Goldbacher', 'Olly Blackburn'], 'Producers': ['Paul Frift', 'Daisy Goodwin', 'Dan McCulloch', 'Damien Timmer'], 'Starring': ['Jenna Coleman', 'Tom Hughes', 'Rufus Sewell'], 'Studio': ['PBS']} Review Text: I LOVE this series! When I first saw season 1, I was blown away. Every single episode seemed like a masterpiece! The character development is superb, the story arcs that they create are so rewarding, and the Victoria and Albert...my heart! As Albert says, "A love like ours can burn down a city." Just a great great watch! I've seen the whole series twice now, and I think I've watched Season 1 at least 3 times. Review Title: A Love story for the ages Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/07/11 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Robert Iscove'], 'Producers': ['John Steven Agoglia', 'Gayla Aspinall', 'Nikki Boella', 'Robert Engelman', 'Simon Fuller'], 'Starring': ['Justin Guarini', 'Kelly Clarkson', 'Greg Siff']} Review Text: Kelly Clarkson thinks of this movie as the bane of her existence, but the girl should be proud! As a preteen and teen, my gal pals and I watched this movie over and over and over, and I can still quote it front to back. I owned it on VHS. One of these friends recently rented it to watch with some of her friends who had never seen it, and when she told me this, I immediately went into a montage of quotes and lyrics that we all knew and love! Then I had to buy it digitally for myself so that I could enjoy it all over again. The movie screams 2000s. The clothes (I STILL am convinced crop tops with kapris and pigtails is a good idea), the hair, the dry tech beats behind the music. The beaches full of "Spring Breakers just ready to PARTAYYYY!" What a gem. I will never not love this movie. Review Title: Seen it 100 times and I still love it Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual's purchasing history reveals a strong affinity for emotionally engaging cinematic experiences, particularly in the genres of romantic comedies and biographical dramas. They consistently rate products highly, with an average rating of 4.7 or above, indicating a preference for quality storytelling and strong character development. 

Themes center around cultural diversity, humorous experiences, and nostalgia, often reflecting a connection to personal memories shared with family or friends during viewings. Quality in production, such as direction, acting, and visual aesthetics appears vital, as all selected movies feature notable contributors and are well-received critically.

The buyer demonstrates a moderate price sensitivity, valuing quality over lower-price alternatives, as evidenced by their choice of award-winning titles and high-caliber productions. Overall, this individual seeks a blend of heartfelt narratives, cultural richness, and humor in cinema, often revisiting beloved classics that evoke strong emotional ties to their past.

target_interaction.title: Finally a Little Women movie that holds up to the charm of the books
target_interaction.text:
I love this movie! I saw it 4 times in the theater. The first time I was with my mom and a theater of women young and old who all probably grew up reading the beloved novel, and 30 minutes into the movie I was already beaming and tearing up because I was just thinking, "FINALLY! They're really doing it! They're making the charm of the book come to life!" By the end of the movie, the theater was in tears of both sadness and joy, and we all left with our hearts warmed.

I've seen just about every Little Women adaptation of the last 30 years, and to me none of them have done true justice to the playfulness, the familial love, the deep friendships, the girls' worries, the girls' joys, the romantic love stories of this book. This movie did it in such a fresh way. I was so so pleased! READ THE BOOK FIRST and fall in love with it, then see the characters come to life.

Sidenote: I could harp on a few things that weren't accurate from the book to screen like the age and nationality of Professor Bhaer, or the age of Amy for that matter. But these things are easy to let slide when the true CHARM and WHIMSY of the story and the NATURE of the characters is captured so well. The movie is nearly perfect.
description: Writer-director Greta Gerwig (Lady Bird) has crafted a Little Women that draws on both the classic novel and the writings of Louisa May Alcott, and unfolds as the author’s alter ego, Jo March, reflects back and forth on her fictional life. In Gerwig’s take, the beloved story of the March sisters – four young women each determined to live life on their own terms – is both timeless and timely. Portraying Jo, Meg, Amy, and Beth March, the film stars Saoirse Ronan, Emma Watson, Florence Pugh, Eliza Scanlen, with Timothée Chalamet as their neighbor Laurie, Laura Dern as Marmee, and Meryl Streep as Aunt March.
target_interaction.store: Saoirse Ronan  (Actor),     Emma Watson  (Actor),     Greta Gerwig  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
